content:
How do I address an email using one of those mailing lists in the PAB.

You use the name of the mailing list in the To: field. https://kb.mozillazine.org/Mailing_lists

Didn't work.

What exactly didn't work?
creator: christ1

content: The attempt to fight spam with static filters is futile. The built-in junk mail controls are your best bet. https://support.mozilla.org/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages
creator: christ1

content:
I get prompted via the web login of Microsoft (i.e. different from the attached error message) and the app password I generated doesn't work, only the general password for my account works.

With OAuth2 authentication you'll have to use the main account password, not an app password.

Also see https://support.mozilla.org/kb/microsoft-oauth-authentication-and-thunderbird-202
creator: christ1

content: To clarify, Thunderbird is an email client, not an email provider. The price is free, although we survive only by user donations. I believe you will lose that email address when the provider drops service and will need a different one. There are many alternatives available, with some free (such as gmail.com and gmx.com), and fee-based (such as fastmail.com). You can use Thunderbird to administer the email account from PC, Linux, or Mac.
creator: davidsk
